title: Ichiei Muroi
text:
is a former <a href="Japan">Japan</a>ese <a href="Association%20football">football</a> player.
Playing career.
Muroi was born in <a href="Saitama%20%28city%29">Saitama</a> on June 22, 1974. After graduating from high school, he joined <a href="Kashima%20Antlers">Kashima Antlers</a> in 1993. Although he could not become a regular player behind <a href="Yutaka%20Akita">Yutaka Akita</a> and <a href="Ryosuke%20Okuno">Ryosuke Okuno</a>, he played as an important substitute center back player. The club won the champions <a href="1996%20J.League">1996</a>, <a href="1998%20J.League">1998 J1 League</a>, <a href="1997%20J.League%20Cup">1997 J.League Cup</a> and <a href="1997%20Emperor%27s%20Cup">1997 Emperor's Cup</a>. In 2000, he moved to his local club <a href="Urawa%20Reds">Urawa Reds</a> in <a href="J2%20League">J2 League</a>. He played many matches and the club was promoted to <a href="J1%20League">J1 League</a>. In 2001, he could hardly play in the match and he moved to <a href="Cerezo%20Osaka">Cerezo Osaka</a> in July. However the club results were bad and was relegated to J2 League. In 2002, he returned to Urawa Reds. He played many matches and the club won the champions <a href="2003%20J.League%20Cup">2003 J.League Cup</a>. In 2005, he moved to <a href="Vissel%20Kobe">Vissel Kobe</a>. However he could not play many matches and moved to <a href="Yokohama%20FC">Yokohama FC</a> in 2006. He retired end of 2007 season.
